Job DescriptionWe are currently looking for an Associate Executive Director for our Citrus Place community, in Riverside, CA! 
Salary: 80,000/yearIdeal candidates will enroll in our 12-month Executive Director in Training program and must be willing to relocate to any of our communities for a promotion as Executive Director.
Job Summary: The primary purpose of the Associate Executive Director is to assist in directing the day- to- day functions of the Community under the supervision of the Executive Director while demonstrating the Principles and Core Values that MBK embraces. The Associate Executive Director is a hands on training position that prepares this Team Member to assume full responsible for the overall management and direction of the day- to- day operations of the Community in accordance with all Federal, State, local and Licensing Regulations, and all Company Policies and Procedures. This training will be conducted through the Executive Director in Training (EDIT) program. 
Essential Job Duties (Include % of time for each responsibility):- Assist the Executive Director in planning, developing, organizing, implementing and directing the day- to- day functions of the community (100%)- Assume administrative authority, responsibility and accountability for directing the management and control of the property under the direction of the Executive Director. (100%)- Assist department leaders in the development and implementation of departmental policies and procedures and establish rapport in and among departments to demonstrate and encourage the importance of teamwork (100%)- Participate in all aspects of the EDIT Program (100%)- Assure that residents are appropriate to levels of care for property licensure and receive proper services with regard to their physical & emotional needs (75%)- Ensure residents are able to attend activities and community programs/events as desired arranging for transportation as necessary (20%)- Promote and market the property assisting with the implementation of referral and other programs to reach and exceed occupancy goals (100%)- Assist with the contract signing with new residents or resident transfers (10% if you are 100% full)- Prepare and submit monthly reports (ex. Move- out information) and billing information, invoices, etc. for submission to Corporate (10%)- Maintain all required education units with complete understanding and knowledge of all Federal, State and Local government regulations and industry trends (100%)- Prepare rent increase letters, leases and other communication as directed for residents (5%)- Assist in the physical property maintenance making modifications and/or recommendations to ensure a safe and secure environment for all Team Members, residents, guests and visitors in compliance with OSHA requirements, established safety policies, practices and plans (100%)- Closely managing all workers’ compensation injuries, investigations, or safety complaints under the direction of the Executive Director (20%)- Represent the community with a positive and professional image through dress and behaviors interacting with outside agencies (including government agencies), community representatives, family members, participating in surveys and responding to inquiries or developing plan of corrections as necessary under the direction of the Executive Director (100%)- Perform other duties as necessary and as assigned by Executive Director or corporate offices (5%)- Assist with recruitment and hiring efforts supervising staff under the direction of the Executive Director (5%)- Make recommendations to the Executive Director on Team Member performance, pay rates/increases, disciplines and terminations ensuring they are fair, consistent and in compliance with company policies and all state and federal laws (20%)- Collaborate and consult with department directors to assist in correcting problem areas and improving service to residents (70%)- Support and cover department head duties during department head absences through delegation or personal completion working in conjunction with a designated Manager on Duty for those times the Executive Director is not on the property (20%)- Promote and lead with a spirit of teamwork and cooperation (100%)
Non- Essential Job Duties:- May need to assist in moving residents in emergency situations.
Requirements (Include: Education, Experience, Special Skills, Licenses, and Certifications):- Must be age 21, or over- 4 year degree from an accredited college preferred- (CA requires 2 years of continuous college education)- Minimum two (2) years’ experience in senior living operations- RCFE certification, preferred.- Background clearances as required by government regulations- Complete a health screening and provide negative TB test results (must be within the last 6 months or within 7 days of employment)- Some supervisory experience preferred- Basic math skills (addition, subtraction) as required by the position- Excellent communication skills including the ability to speak, write and read English- Must possess the ability to make independent decisions when circumstances warrant such action and to remain calm during stressful or emergency situations- Must possess the ability and desire to minimize waste and misuse of supplies/equipment- Ability to deal tactfully and professionally at all times with personnel, residents, family members, visitors and the general public- Must complete EDIT application and fully participate in the EDIT program.

title: Account Manager
description:
What's the role?

We’re looking for account managers from all different backgrounds to join our regional sales team. This is no ordinary sales job, as ours is a uniquely high performing and supportive working culture.

Who is Hilti?

Hilti is where innovation is improving productivity, safety and sustainability in the global construction industry, and beyond. Where strong customer relationships are creating solutions that build a better future. Where there is pride and a sense of belonging across our 120 locations, carrying right into our lives and homes. Where people are exploring possibilities, leveraging their potential, owning their personal development and growing lasting careers.

What does the role involve?

The purpose of the role is to create value in the allocated account's portfolio through effective design and implementation of individual account strategies to build long term, sustainable and profitable relationships with the customer. The role involves professional field sales and high level customer consultation in the defined territory within the target industry. The job holder needs to provide efficient solutions and technical support to customers and represent the Hilti brand in the market place.

93% of our people say they're proud to work for Hilti, thanks to the quality of our products and the way we look after our people.

What do we offer?

We’ll give you lots of responsibility, including your own portfolio of customers and these might be trades experts, project managers, or company leaders. From there, we’ll trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and we’ll reward you with unrivaled training, development, and career opportunities as soon as you’re ready for the next challenge.

Day to day you’ll report to your regional sales manager, who will also be there to help you manage your career.

In addition to a competitive base salary and uncapped bonus potential, we offer a robust benefits package including a generous paid time off policy that includes vacation, personal days, health & wellness, and 2 days per year to give back in your local community, paid family leave, educational reimbursement and student loan assistance, 401(k) matching, medical/dental/vision coverage, and a variety of other benefits to fit the needs of our employees.

We will give you the tools you need to succeed through hands-on integration training and will support your continued professional development through ongoing training and mentoring, targeted leadership programs, and opportunities for international assignments in any of the 120+ countries in which we operate.

What you need is:

 Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience.  At least one-year prior experience in customer service and/ or sales working directly with customers, preferred (either over phone or face-to-face).  Ability to thrive both independently and in a team environment.  Demonstrated ability to develop engaged customer relationships and effectively implement strategic concepts.  Excellent time and territory management skills.  Must be persuasive, sales driven, customer focused, and a team player.  Proficient computer skills including MS Office Suite, and smartphones.  Must maintain a professional business appearance in accordance with HNA (Hilti North America) dress policy at all times.  Career advancement may require domestic and/or global mobility. 


Why should you apply?

We have an excellent mix of people and some of our best account managers joined us with little or no construction experience. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.

Hilti, Inc is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: Senior Buyer
description:
Grow alongside Pearson, as we disrupt the packaging industry with innovative ways of solving our customers’ automation production needs. Challenge the status quo, apply new ways of thinking and help us dominate the secondary packaging automation market. 
With our portfolio of case erectors, robotic top-loaders, sealers and robotic palletizers, Pearson Packaging Systems helps a diverse set of high-volume manufacturers and distributors in the food, beverage, personal care, chemical and online commerce industries overcome labor cost and supply, safety, quality and throughput challenges. Since our inception, more than 65 years ago we have deployed over 22,000 machines.
To be able to deliver on our promise to our customers, maintain our values of integrity, service and continuous improvement, and sustain growth rates well above industry expectations, we look for people who care – care to make a difference and go the extra mile to exceed customer expectations, both internally and externally. Join Pearson and be a part of a team that values growth, collaboration and continuous learning. We look forward to welcoming you into our innovative and supportive team.
Your role with us:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Buyer to join our procurement team. The Senior Buyer will be a motivated and organized individual who plays a crucial role in sourcing, negotiating, and procuring materials, components, and services necessary for our manufacturing process. This position requires a strategic mindset, exceptional negotiation skills, and a deep understanding of supply chain management within equipment manufacturing.
Does this sound like you?
You are an excellent communicator and adept negotiator. You excel in communication, adeptly conveying information with clarity and precision while also actively listening to others. Your balanced approach involves valuing inputs from various sources to determine the best course of action. You have the ability to persuade and influence others in a positive manner and a proven track record of successfully negotiating contracts, reducing costs, and improving supplier performance. 
You have strong analytical skills and are data driven. You possess strong analytical capabilities and a keen eye for detail. Your proficiency lies in thoroughly reviewing and analyzing data inputs as an integral part of your role, ensuring accuracy and precision in your work as well as the ability to identify trends and make data-driven decisions. 
You have the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. You assess the urgency and importance of various tasks, strategically allocating your time and resources to ensure deadlines are met without compromising quality. Whether it involves juggling multiple projects simultaneously or swiftly adapting to shifting priorities, your proactive approach and effective time management skills enable you to thrive in dynamic work settings. 
You have Supply Chain experience. You have in depth knowledge of quality standards and industry best practices related to procurement and supply chain management. 
How you will contribute to our growth: 
Strategic Sourcing Lead strategic sourcing initiatives to identify and evaluate potential suppliers, negotiate contracts, and establish long-term partnerships that align with the company’s objectives and quality standards. Continually seek new sourcing opportunities to achieve cost reduction, cost avoidance, and cost containment objectives
Supplier Relationship Management Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential suppliers to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality materials and components while optimizing costs and mitigating risks.Negotiate favorable terms and conditions, including pricing, payment terms, delivery schedules, and quality standards, to secure advantageous contracts and minimize supply chain disruptions.Monitor supplier performance metrics, conduct regular supplier audits, and implement corrective actions as needed to ensure compliance with contractual agreements and quality requirements.
Cost and Risk Management Drive cost reduction initiatives through effective negotiation, value engineering, and alternative sourcing strategies without compromising product quality or delivery timelines. Proactively identify potential supply chain risks, develop contingency plans, and implement risk mitigation strategies to minimize disruptions and ensure continuity of supply.
Cross Functional Collaboration Work closely with cross functional teams, including engineering, manufacturing, and project management to align procurement activities with production schedules, quality standards, and project requirements.

What you will need to succeed: Bachelor's degree in supply chain, Logistics, Operations, Industrial Engineering, or Systems Engineering or 5 years’ experience in procurement, strategic sourcing, supply chain management, or production planning in manufacturing operationExperience in and understanding of lean manufacturing and materials conceptsProficient in excel, work, and ERP systemsEquipment manufacturing procurement experience preferredProfessional certification (CSCP, CPSM) a plus
What we will offer you: Competitive industry compensation.On the job training and mentorship as well as opportunities for career advancement.Our top-tier Health and Wellness Plan offers ease of mind and ensures that you and your family are well taken care of.Time and time again, we have been recognized amongst the most progressive workplaces in our industry.
Ready to join us?

description:

title: Application Engineer
description:
Location: Elgin, IL

About SKF: 

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer that&aposs dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth.

SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Education, Knowledge, And Requirements:

4 years Mechanical Engineering degree or equivalent.Demonstrates knowledge of dynamic seal design and testing with specialized customer application engineering seal experience.Minimum of 2 year’s experience as Seals AE.Demonstrates initiative and creative ability.Must be able to translate design theory into practical application and follow project through successful completion including coordinating of efforts internally and with the customer.Exercises good discretionary decision making in line with corporate policy when dealing with customers or professional groups.Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to influence others.Exhibit good presentation skills.

This is a working Group Lead position and is expected to contribute to the maintenance activities in the production area at least 70% of the time and perform administrative tasks in the office 30% of the time.

Primary Responsibilities

This position has Supervisory responsibility for decisions that directly impact the Production Maintenance Team as well as site manufacturing activities and product quality. Lead the assigned Production Maintenance shift to cost effectively produce a quality product that meets all regulatory and customer needs. Support maintenance and production areas by demonstrating leadership behaviors: a self-starter who is organized, detailed, conscientious, and ambitious. A team player with a positive attitude, approaching projects/tasks with a sense of ownership and a focus on root cause analysis/sustainable failure prevention. Review preventative/corrective maintenance activities with a focus on constant improvement of existing procedures/processes and insures that all required documentation and records are maintained in accordance with site procedures and cGMP. Periodic PM execution verification checks for quality of service. Lead troubleshooting efforts to solve and address complex problems. Drive efforts in root cause analysis and continuous equipment/system improvement as well as infrastructure improvement toward the implementation of sustainable reliability based maintenance program. Plans, initiates, and tracks progress of work assignments utilizing CMMS to meet manufacturing schedules and needs; effectively communicates status across shifts, throughout Production, and to site management. Provides training, mentoring, and drives professional development. Perform departmental audits. Responsible to follow all site Safety Policies/OSHA policies including requirements as related to personal protection equipment as needed to perform routine and non-routine duties. Assist in special assignments with outside technicians or departments such as training or personnel. 

Education, Skills, & Experience

Minimum of 8 years of professional maintenance experience with strong hands-on knowledge of electrical, mechanical, and control systems. ORAssociate’s Degree with a minimum of 5 years of experience working with manufacturing equipment, CMMS, and spare parts inventory management preferred. Experience in a regulated environment desired. Minimum 3 years in a leadership role. 

BioFire Diagnostics, LLC. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. title: Business Unit Analyst
description:
Job Description

Company Summary

We’re the producers, creators and marketers of beer, wine and spirts brands that people love. At Constellation Brands, we’re driven to push boundaries and think beyond today to deliver products and experiences that resonate now, tomorrow and well into the future. Because of this approach, we’re the fastest-growing large CPG company in the U.S. at retail, with operations in the U.S., Mexico, New Zealand and Italy. Our premium portfolio of iconic brands like Corona Extra, Modelo Especial, Kim Crawford, Robert Mondavi, Meiomi, The Prisoner, SVEDKA Vodka, High West Whiskey, and more drive industry-leading growth for us today. But we’re just getting started. Our ability to stay on the forefront of consumer trends has fueled our success since our founding in 1945 and will guide us in creating the next generation of products and experiences Worth Reaching For.

Position Summary

The Business Unit Analyst is responsible for developing and delivering sales analysis and comprehensive data reporting in their assigned Business Unit. Working in conjunction with Field Sales, the Business Unit Analysis Manager and under the general direction of the Business Unit Operations Director, the Business Unit Analyst evaluates the overall arc of the Business Unit performance against plan targets and identifies opportunities to bridge depletions, distribution and incentive program gaps. 

Responsibilities

Provides monthly benchmarking and scorecard reporting on results and standings relative to plan performance, distribution, depletions, billings and retail execution using CBI data mining tools. Develops and circulates reports recapping BU and distributor performance versus targets.Collaborating with the BU Analysis Manager, the BU Analyst establishes, develops, and manages all BU data reporting processes.Identifies key success measures for incentives/programming and evaluates ROI.Provides monthly sales versus forecast analysis to the BU Operations Director. Manages select elements of monthly forecast under guidance and direction of BU Operations Director. Develops reporting capabilities to support BU inventory management activities and assists with product allocations.Develops presentation materials, tools, and data for BU sales and wholesaler meetings. Participates in periodic field market visits, wholesaler meetings and Retail Vision surveys with BU Field sales team members to gain an understanding of market dynamics and apply insights to sales support projects. Assists in the on-boarding and training of new BU employees in the utilization of the CBI data mining programs. Functions as the BU liaison and subject matter expert in support of several corporate initiatives including, but not limited to: Wholesaler Annual Business Plan, Retail Vision data collection, IRI, and National Incentive Program Trackers. Partners with the Key Accounts team members, National Sales and Business Operations in the development and completion of wholesaler and key market data analysis.Responsible for ensuring BU data management and integrity.Completes ah-hoc projects and tasks as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis on business, marketing, finance or related field and or 1-3 years of experience in business analytics.Ability to retrieve and synthesize sales data to deliver persuasive and fact-based sales presentations. 

Preferred Qualifications

Demonstrated ability to learn internal software applications and specialized customer tools as required.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to work with a variety of individuals at all organizational levels both internal and external. Partners with stakeholders to establish clear parameters for deliverables and follow-up timeframes.Proficient with software to include Excel (at an advanced level), PowerPoint, Word and Microsoft Outlook.Precise, detail-oriented, analytical, and deadline-driven with the ability to work under pressure. Must take initiative and work with a high level of professionalism.Demonstrates high degree of critical thinking skills and flexibility. 

Physical Requirements/Work Environment

Work Environment:Must be able to stand, walk, sitMust be able to move up to 55 lbsUse hands to handle or feel; reach with hands and armsClimb or balance stairs/laddersStoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk and hearMust have close vision, distant vision, and ability to adjust focus, peripheral visionMust be able to stand for extended periods of timeMust have a valid driver’s license, be able to drive a car and travel via plane/train as neededMust be at least 21 years or age. Must be able to sit and/or stand for long periods of time and work on a computer for extended periods. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Location

Orlando, Florida

Additional Locations

Atlanta, Georgia, Charlotte, North Carolina, Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Miami, Florida, Tampa, Florida, West Palm Beach, Florida

Job Type

Full time

Job Area

Sales Support

The salary range for this role is:

$71,600.00 - $107,400.00

This is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but limited to, the prevailing minimum wage for the location, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, any collective bargaining agreements, and business or organizational needs. We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), and any other benefits to eligible employees.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, or any other form of compensation that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

Equal Opportunity

Constellation Brands is committed to a continuing program of equal employment opportunity. All persons have equal employment opportunities with Constellation Brands, regardless of their sex, race, color, age, religion, creed, sexual orientation, national origin or citizenship, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer or genetic characteristics), marital status, gender (including gender identity or gender expression), familial status, military or veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, childbirth, breast
feeding, or related conditions (or any other group or category within the framework of the applicable discrimination laws and regulations).

Not sure you meet all qualifications? Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.

title: Senior Analyst, Social
description:
About Spark Foundry:
Spark Foundry is a global media agency that exists to bring HEAT – Higher Engagement, Affinity, and Transactions – to brands. By combining flawless media fundamentals with aggressive innovation, Spark inspires consumers to pay more attention, to care more about our clients’ brands, and to buy more products and services from them.
Balancing the nimble spirit of a startup with the powerhouse soul of Publicis Media, Spark Foundry delivers the best of both worlds to a client roster that spans some of the world’s best and most beloved brands and companies. We combine boutique-caliber insights and service with the buying clout and first-look access of a global leader, bringing the heat to challenger brands that want to act like giants, and to giant brands that want to act like challengers.
With a bottom-up culture that celebrates diversity and aims for all voices to be heard, Spark has become a magnet for the industry’s best talent, with one of the best retention rates in the industry. And by applying a whole-person approach to professional and personal development, Spark develops a workforce that is well prepared for today’s challenges, and also poised to create meaningful careers in the years to come.
Because we know that heat arises the intersection of complementary forces, our professionals come from myriad disciplines and backgrounds: data, analytics, and insights, content and creative production, communications and strategy, finance and marketing, and sociology, psychology, and other liberal arts disciplines.Job DescriptionOverview:
The Senior Analyst, Paid Social is responsible for leading the success of client-paid social media campaigns by providing thoughtful leadership on campaign strategies and optimization, building strong relationships, and establishing clear lines of communication with clients, partners, and internal staff members.Role Objectives:Use analytical and problem-solving capabilities to ensure flawless campaign execution to meet and exceed stated client objectivesDirect bid strategy, campaign optimizations, and reporting for paid social media campaignsOversee budgets and flighting for all self-service platformsManage rate tracking, benchmarking, planning costs, and overall budget for client accountsForecast around audits and campaign analyticsAssist the Manager and greater team with overall strategy and recommendationsServe as a mentor to Analysts and available for ad hoc questions and trainingQualifications1-2 years of paid social media experience requiredDemonstrated experience buying and planning across multiple platforms including Facebook, X, Reddit, Snapchat, TikTok, Yelp, Uber Eats, Doordash, Instagram, and PinterestExperience working in a client-facing capacityExperience using paid media to complement earned media campaigns and meet business objectivesProficiency in MS Office with specific strengths in Excel and PowerPointAble to work independently and balance multiple tasksGenuine interest in the digital media space and enjoys staying up-to-date on industry trendsAdditional InformationThis is a hybrid role, requiring three days in-office each week. If you are contacted for an interview, your recruiter will discuss specifics with you, inclusive of any necessary reasonable accommodations.If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contacthrcompliance_usms@publicis.com.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.24-5118

description:

title: Entry-level Sales Executive (B2B)
description:
Starting in 2000, Eight Eleven Group, our parent company, committed to growing 100% organically, promoting solely from within, while always keeping culture and growth opportunities at the forefront of the business model. What began as a two-person Indianapolis start-up, has rapidly expanded to become a market-leading organization within one of the fastest growing industries today: Staffing and Recruiting. We take a relationship-based, experience-driven approach with our Fortune 1000 clients to help them solve their workforce challenges. We are not just in the business of recruiting and hiring - we are in the business of making a meaningful and authentic impact both internally with our employees and externally with our clients and consultants.
As a Brooksource Sales Executive, you will be in an outside sales role, taking a relationship-driven, client-focused, consultative approach. Your goal is to spend 75% of your time in front of hiring managers, building partnerships, and taking time to understand how you can add value to the organization’s hiring process. We use a solution-based selling approach, which includes a Relationship Lifecycle methodology, and quantitative activity-based goals. Here’s what you will do:

title: Non-Destructive Testing Level III Specialist
description:
Non-Destructive Testing 

Level III 

Specialist

Location: Ladson, SC

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings, made in Muskegon, played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030. 

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Summary

Venture Aerobearings LLC is a joint venture established by SKF and GE Aviation to manufacture aeroengine bearings for the commercial aircraft industry. The manufacturing facility is located in Ladson, SC and brings together the latest technology from both GE and SKF and using a self-directed/high performing team concept. Venture Aerobearings continues to improve the manufacturing processes through innovative use of equipment and inspection while striving towards digital transformation.

The NDT Level III Specialist reports to the Quality Leader and is responsible for the day-to-day technical support for nondestructive testing. The individual will be named the NDT Responsible Level III for the plant. Oversight includes the disciplines of Magnetic Particle Inspection (MT), Eddy Current inspection (ET), and Nital Etch inspection (STE). This individual will work in concert with the Quality Leader to provide the overall technical leadership and direction for Nondestructive Evaluation at Venture Aerobearings LLC.

Responsibilities

The successful candidate will primarily:Maintain customer and/ or Nadcap approval of the NDT systems as required.Develop, update, and implement NDT procedures and work instructions required for equipment and processes used for NDT inspection.Develop, utilize, and maintain documentation necessary for training new and existing NDT inspectors and candidates. Administer training as well as written and practical examinations, for the above individuals.Make final determination on acceptability of questionable hardware found by the NDT process.Maintain necessary documentation for the control of the NDT processes, including equipment, tooling, and supplies.

The candidate will additionally support:Plant level AS9100 systems and processes including: external and internal audits, process documentation and maintenance.Customer specification review and flow-down.Vendor related activities.Monitoring, control, and disposition of non-conforming material.Initiation and monitoring of corrective actions.Continuous improvement activities including Lean and Six Sigma.
Requirements

The position requires a Bachelor’s Degree in a related engineering or science field; (or a high school diploma/GED with at least 4 years of experience in a manufacturing or shop environment). NDT Level III certification in two (2) of the three (3) NDT disciplines used at Venture Aerobearings (MT, ET, STE) or the individual must be able to achieve NDT Level III status in two (2) disciplines within six (6) months achieving ASNT, NAS 410, and/or customer certification for each discipline as required. Work in a self-directed/high performing team environment.

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work /life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being, and health. Flexible work options available, depending on role.

SKF Celebrates Diversity in the Workplace: We strive to embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Quality/EHS Leader

Location: Ladson, SC

Job ID: 18571

Pay $90000 to $120000 per year

SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

By applying to this job you acknowledge how SKF treats candidate data. Click HERE to review the SKF Data Privacy Consent Statement.

title: CNC Manufacturing Engineer
description:
Manufacturing Engineer

Location: Ladson, SC

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Summary

The Manufacturing Engineer is responsible for supporting existing manufacturing processes, as well as planning, recommending, and developing new manufacturing, gauging, and support functions to produce Venture Aerobearings LLC products.

Venture Aerobearings LLC, (VA) a joint venture between SKF and GE Aviation, was created in August 2007. VA was founded by our parent companies to be an innovative aerospace manufacturer of high precision, jet engine bearings. Our mandate is to safely and rapidly produce higher quality, lower cost bearings for our customers, using self-directed work teams, cutting edge technology, and lean six sigma processes. VA provides personal, professional, and business growth through its continuous research and training processes. Our teams consist of diverse individuals from various backgrounds whose focus is to continually bring ground breaking and innovative ideas for the growth of VA.

Responsibilities Include But Not Limited To

Provide technical leadership for assigned equipment, processes, and products, attaining quality and excellence, with cost superiority. Maintain all process documentation (Setup sheets, drawings, routings, work instructions) for assigned equipment, processes, and products.Provide engineering support and guidance to Bearing Technicians for incorporating process changes, special rework processes, design changes and/or implementing new designs.Establish processes that generate parts meeting customer and quality requirements at minimum cost. Evaluate test and performance data regularly to identify opportunities for continuous improvement.Design and integrate improved capabilities into existing and new equipment. Apply analytical and computational techniques to problem solving. Lead and/or provide engineering support to assigned projects intended to develop programs, optimize productivity, or reduce cycle time, manufacturing losses and/or overall shop costs. Collaborate with Production to aid in the establishment of specifications for new manufacturing equipment and processes.Collaborate and advise in the installation of new manufacturing equipment and processes.Use Lean Six Sigma practices in daily activities and problem-solving situations.Participate in the review of Government regulations and standards in the areas of health and safety regarding manufacturing equipment and the production process.Ensure adherence to the Quality Control Systems plan. Provide engineering support to assist VA personnel to interface with Design, Engine Assembly, and Vendors as appropriate to ensure smooth flow of quality hardware at lower cost. Provide focus for customer support and response to customer identified problems. 

Requirements

A Bachelors degree in a related engineering field.Or a high school diploma/GED with at least 4 years engineering experience or 10 years of relevant manufacturing experience.Minimum 3 years related manufacturing experience with CAD/CAM, CNC, and standard machine tools.Candidates must possess excellent interpersonal, analytical, and personal computing skills.Must be able to work independently in a high performance/self-directed facility.Position may require providing off-shift support.Travel as needed.

Desired Qualifications

Familiar with Mori-Seiki/Fanuc controllers.Siemens NX CAD/CAM design.Hard turning/Milling/Fixture design.CNC Multi-Axis Grinding/Honing/Work Holding design.

What You’ll Love About SKF

title: Metallurgical Engineer
description:
Location: Muskegon, MI

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030. 

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

This position is responsible for supporting a variety of Metallurgical services including metallographic and physical testing, product / process control testing and development, failure analysis, and problem solving. The incumbent also provides leadership and support for assigned programs and projects to ensure compliance with customer specifications, internal engineering standards, and AS9100 quality system requirements in a custom precision manufacturing facility.

Responsibilities

Provide ongoing metallurgical analyses and physical test results for production process control, product quality assurance, and provides product and material analyses.Review drawings, compare internal and external specifications against manufacturing processes, identifies gaps, and provides timely information to address discrepancies.Provide technical support to the manufacturing floor, including visual aids, instructions, inspection forms, etc., to support Production and Quality objectives.Conduct periodic Quality reviews and internal audits (Flight Safety, AS9100, Gauge R&R, Capability studies, PFMEA, etc.).Perform routine and non-routine audits on laboratory procedures and analyses ensuring high levels of accuracy in both testing procedures and evaluations.Serve as the resident “Subject Matter Expert” for Heat Treating and Chemical Processing activities with an emphasis on Nadcap requirements.Perform various tests including surface temper etch, macro- and microhardness, physical, and mechanical property testing.Monitors Heat Treat equipment to ensure that the requirements of any/all applicable industry pyrometry standards are met.Develop and maintain work instructions, processing parameters and processing methods conforming to customer and/or industry standards.Prepare metallurgical specimens for analysis, makes accept/reject decisions, and reports the results as required.Oversee the training, training requirement, qualifications, and skill enhancement of Metallurgical Laboratory and Heat Treat Technicians.Establish and enforce safe laboratory practices.Provide leadership, support, and guidance to other departments as necessary.Interface with customers on areas of expertise and responsibilities as required.Develop competencies in areas of interest, such as Advanced Quality techniques, Continuous Improvement, Process Development, scrap reduction, etc.Perform other duties as assigned, scheduled and/or required.

Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Material Science or similar Engineering discipline, with one to three (1 to 3) years manufacturing experience.Background in metal removal, alloy steel thermal processing (thru-hardening, carburizing, temper, etc.), chemical processing, AMS2750, and Nadcap requirements preferred.Physically mobile and able to safely perform routine tasks (standing, sitting, bending, lifting up to 40 lbs).Must have a solid understanding of business, cost elements, and manufacturing processes.An advanced level of mechanical comprehension.Solid analytical problem-solving skills.Must be able to effectively interact with all levels of the organization both orally and written.Desire to develop competencies in areas of interest, such as Advanced Quality techniques, Continuous Improvement, Process Development, scrap reduction, etc.

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health. Flexible work options available, depending on role.

Diversity in the Workplace. At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement, and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

title: Regional Controller
description:
About Compass Group At Compass Group, GREAT PEOPLE are at the core of our business! Our talented teams work tirelessly crafting incredible food experiences to help fuel the teams creating world-changing technologies at one of the world’s major tech companies! The food and experiences we provide make quite an impact! As we continue to move forward, we’re more passionate than ever about supporting the long-term success & wellness of everyone we feed, and we love what we do.
Role Summary:The Regional Controller will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the accounting function, ensuring accurate and timely financial reporting, and providing valuable financial insights to support strategic decision-making. You will work closely with your Compass colleagues, as well as wider Compass and client stakeholders to support their different needs. The Regional Controller will report to the Director of Finance, Compass at Google and will have the opportunity to inspire, lead and develop a small team who will manage the financial aspects of the business, including invoicing, payroll, forecasting, analysis and contract governance. 
Location: Onsite in Sunnyvale California 
The great things you’ll do
Budgeting / Forecasting: Collaborate with all lines of business and cafe operations to develop realistic and achievable annual budgets for both the client and Compass, as well as quarterly client forecasts.Monitor and analyze budget variances and KPIs, making recommendations, and taking corrective actions as neededAR Invoicing Process: Establish and maintain efficient processes for issuing invoicesMaintain processes for purchase order creation and monitoringEnsure timely and accurate billing for all services renderedPayroll: Oversee the payroll process for all employees.Incident escalation to Compass or Sector for resolution.AP Process:Manage the overall process of AP audit/reconciliation. Manage the AP uploads from vendors to Google through Google’s systems.Collaborate with end users in operations on issue mitigation and training.Manage the purchase order (PO) process for Google with Compass@Google Vendor Relations. Reporting:Prepare reporting for the client forecast versus actual monthly reconciliation.Prepare reporting for the client Committed Spend monthly meeting based on month to date data.Prepare monthly forecast/committed spend/actual expense for client input into their accounting systems.Internal Controls: Implement and maintain a robust system of internal controls to safeguard the company's assets and ensure financial data integrity.Conduct regular reviews of internal control procedures, flagging risks to appropriate parties, and recommending improvements for continued effectiveness.Ensure that close deadlines are met weekly, monthly, quarterly and annually. Additional Responsibilities:Oversee the general accounting team, providing guidance and support.Manage relationships with multiple stakeholders for reporting and research purposes.Manage and ensure year-end reconciliations and audit requests go smoothly.Support client deliverables and ad hoc requests in an accurate and timely manner.Stay up-to-date on relevant accounting standards and US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (US GAAP).
What we look for in a great candidateBachelor's degree in Accounting or a related field.Certified Public Accountant (CPA) license preferred.Minimum 5+ years of experience in a financial controller or senior accounting role; food service industry preferred.Proven experience in managing the entire invoicing process.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Excellent skills in G-Suite & Microsoft applications and R, SQL scripts.Ability to partner with cross-functional finance and operations teams.Ability to handle and manage multiple projects and work streams.
Sound good? Apply now to take your seat at our table! 
Please submit your resume as a pdf
Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.

title: Tax Associate
description:

title: Director, SRE
description:
The Opportunity
The Director, Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) is responsible for critical contributions to the technology strategy, architecture, and standards for the cloud enablement strategies. The Director, SRE is responsible for leading and managing a team of engineers to ensure the high availability, performance, and scalability of Euna’s cloud infrastructure and services. Primary focus will be on building and maintaining a reliable and robust technology ecosystem, guaranteeing exceptional service uptime and customer satisfaction. The incumbent engages regularly in thought leadership and must understand the complexities of application services in multiple cloud environments. The Director delivers impactful contributions, KPI’s, progress reports and key metrics to senior leaders for enterprise technology initiatives.
Responsibilities:Formulates and executes a comprehensive strategy to ensure the reliability, scalability, and performance of the Euna cloud application environments.Identifies and prioritizes areas for improvement, create roadmaps, and establish measurable goals to track progress and drive continual enhancement.Drives the adoption of automation, monitoring, and alerting tools to enhance the reliability and availability of our systems.Collaborates with engineering teams to design and implement self-healing systems, proactively identifying potential issues and automating recovery processes.Evaluates, selects, develops, and maintains relationships with strategic vendors and business partners to ensure quality, reliability, flexibility, and cost control.Ensures that all developing proposals and planning work are consistent with both strategic plans & business objectives.Manages SRE team to ensure adequate staffing and efficiency through training, counseling, supervising, and reviewing the performance of employees.Establishes and utilizes service level agreements, key performance indicators (KPIs), and metrics to ensure the availability, quality, and performance of cloud infrastructure systems meet and exceed business requirements.Develops short and long-term objectives and plans, as well as provides guidance for the career growth and development of SRE team.
Required Qualifications:Technical proficiency in scripting languages (Python, Shell, Go) and infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, Ansible).Experience mentoring team members and conducting regular talent assessments and provide feedback.Experience in managing teams, with a proven track record to lead strong-willed technical professionalsExperience in cloud computing with focus on micro services.In-depth knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and experience with cloud migration projectsFamiliarity with Agile and DevOps principles and processesProven ability in developing and implementing performance metrics in the areas of service level agreements, system and network uptime measurements, and performance monitoringAbility to prioritize and organize tasks and projects at different stages of completion, identify targets and milestones, and to negotiate as appropriateDemonstrated ability to create viable business cases for enterprise enhancementsAbility to communicate efficiently and effectively both verbally and in writing, upward, downward, and across the organization, and with third partiesDemonstrated ability to develop and foster the professional growth of team members
Preferred Qualifications:5+ years as a Senior Engineering LeaderStrong experience with IaaC and infrastructure deployment and configuration using automated tools such as TerraForm, Ansible, or CloudFormationStrong experience running K8s in AWS.Strong experience in deploying and supporting Cloud resources including Application Gateway, API Gateway, Microservices, Containerized Workloads, Event Streaming, etc. natively in AWSStrong technical expertise in DevOps practices, methodologies, and tools, such as CI/CD, IaC, configuration management, automated testing, and release management.
Location:This will be a remote position within the US or Canada. 
What It's Like to Work at Euna Solutions At Euna Solutions, we carefully foster a work environment where employees have a safe space for creative and intellectual freedom, and the opportunity to work cross-functionally. We offer a dynamic environment with considerable opportunity for professional growth and advancement. 
Here are some of the perks that Euna employees enjoy: 💵 Competitive wages We pay competitive wages and salaries, and we only expect an honest 40-hour week for it. 🧘‍♀️ Wellness days What’s better than a long weekend? An extra-long weekend! This summer let's begin and end the summer with an extra day on top of the long weekend (July and Sept)! An extra day to decompress and spend time doing the things you love. 🙌 Community Engagement Committee At Euna, we know how important it is to give back. Our community engagement committee looks for ways to give back to our local communities through time, gifts and skills. 🕰 Flexible time and remote work We understand that what a workday looks like differs by employee and the role requirements. Through our interview process we’ll work with you to ensure it’s a fit for you and the specific role you’re interested in. 💰 Benefits Ask us for a copy of our health and dental benefits! 🎉 Culture committee Celebrate at every occasion with the culture team! They make sure that our team’s culture is bustling with frequent fun events for holidays and special occasions, as well as for miscellaneous fun. 
About Euna Solutions  Euna Solutions is a leading provider of purpose-built, cloud-based solutions that power critical administrative functions and financial operations for the public sector. Formerly GTY Technology, Euna Solutions offers easy-to-use solutions for procurement, payments, grant management, budgeting, permitting and K-12 administration that are proven to increase operational efficiency, transparency, collaboration, and compliance. Euna Solutions is a trusted partner to more than 2,000 government and public sector organizations across North America, empowering digital transformation and streamlining business processes through a relationship- centered, service-focused approach. Euna propels public sector progress. To learn more, visit www.eunasolutions.com. 
Please visit our website: https://eunasolutions.com/careers/ and check out our LinkedIn Pages https://www.linkedin.com/company/eunasolutions/   
We believe in embracing new perspectives and optimizing impact. If you have relatable experience and relevant transferrable skills but feel you may be missing a few of the requirements, we encourage you to apply! We recognize that people have unique career journeys and if you're excited about this role and know you can bring something great to the team, then we want to hear from you. Please know Euna Solutions is committed to providing a comfortable and accessible interview process for every candidate. If there are any accommodations our team can make throughout our hiring process (big or small), please let us know.  For any inquiries or requests regarding accessibility at Euna Solutions, please email recruiting@eunasolutions.com or call our office at 1.877.707.7755. Upon request, appropriate accessible formats or arrangements will be provided as soon as practicable.

title: Account Executive
description:
As an Account Executive, you will be responsible for promoting and selling Niural's advanced solutions, including US payroll and HCM platform, employee benefits, US PEO and Global Employer-Of-Record (EOR) products to new clients within a designated territory for medium-sized businesses. In this role, you will sell our cutting-edge solutions to key decision-makers such as Chief Financial Officers, Chief Operating Officers, Human Resources and Payroll Administrators, and more.
You'll spend most of your time prospecting clients and closing deals. As your deals cross the finish line, you'll enjoy uncapped commissions, luxurious incentive trips, and awards. You will be a part of a team of winners, and carve your successful career path at one of the most well-respected tech startups in the ecosystem. 
About Niural: Niural is AI for payroll and HR. Built with modern money movement rails and enterprise-grade scalability, Niural is named after neural networks, the founding blocks of artificial intelligence, and is a global leader in leveraging AI to streamline payroll and HR operations for companies of all sizes. Niural has everything companies need to take care of their teams - from US payroll to contractor management, from invoice payments to expense management or time tracking, from PEO, EOR to visas, all in one unified system of record. Our clients call it “magical”, and as you get familiar with the platform, you will feel it - there is no other product like it. We pride ourselves on fostering an inclusive culture that encourages innovation, values diverse perspectives, and promotes a sense of belonging. Our founders are repeat entrepreneurs with several successful exits under their belt and were the builders of the original AI SuperAgents - way before ChatGPT existed. Niural is backed by iconic fintech investors such as Inspired Capital, M13, Hustle Fund, GS Ventures, and more. 
Want to make a dent in the universe? Apply now.
Job Responsibilities:Develop and own a targeted account list and develop a territory plan for winning business with companies between 50-1,000 employees.Manage the customer buying journey from start to finish, providing subject matter expertise and guidance to prospective customers.Meet or exceed monthly, quarterly, and yearly revenue targets.Continually develop a robust sales pipeline through individual outreach, collaborating with your SDR and sales leaders.Keep the CRM system up to date with customer information, forecasts, and pipeline data so we can learn more about our business and our sales process.
You will succeed in this role if:You are confidently fearless. You embrace opportunities, take risks, and challenge the status quo.You have an upbeat, persistent style and the ability to cold call, manage your time well, and present your ideas in a clear professional manner on paper, in person, and over the phone.You have an impressive track record of closing sales, winning clients, and managing a territory.Entrepreneurial Spirit. You're a natural leader, resourceful, thrive under pressure, and bounce back quickly.
Requirements:A college degree is great but not required. What's more important is having the skills to do the job. If you don't have a college degree, other acceptable experience could include:
3+ years of sales experience, with a minimum of 1 year selling into the Mid-Market segmentA track record of developing a greenfield territory, executing across the full sales cycle, and adding net new logosAbility to work in cross-functional teams to ensure Customer Success and SatisfactionDesire to work for a fast-paced startup and take on increasing levels of responsibility
Compensation: Competitive salary with unlimited commission structure, equity, top-of-line health benefits, 401K and more

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Life Science People has partnered with a cutting-edge cloud-service company to hire a well-rounded and phenomenal Product Marketing Manager.
With a $33m Series A funding, they are rapidly expanding their capabilities and influence in the biotech space. Positioned at the most crucial intersection in history, Biology & Computation, this company has pioneered a cloud SaaS platform to store, visualize, and analyze data from biological experiments. The mission is to build and disseminate the data infrastructure platform of the biocomputing revolution.
Joining now means becoming part of a startup on the rise, offering competitive equity, benefits, and a chance to work alongside a team of world-class engineers. As the sole Product Marketing Manager, you partner with the Chief of Staff and spearhead innovation from a Product Marketing standpoint.

To best understand the end user, there is a strict requirement for a degree in science, preferably Biology/Physics (or a related scientific field).4+ years' of product marketing experienceTo be considered, please provide a portfolio to showcase your content creation and product launch capabilities.

title: HVAC Parts Specialist - Indianapolis
description:
Job Opportunity: HVAC Parts Specialist with ElitAire in Indianapolis, IN
Do you thrive on helping customers and developing strong relationships? Do you excel at identifying solutions and solving logistic challenges? Are you seeking a career growth opportunity? If your answer is yes, we need to talk!
As a Parts Specialist at ElitAire, you will provide parts and aftermarket support to customers using a broad variety of HVAC equipment. You will also be responsible for processing parts sales, customer orders, and responding to customer’s inquiries and questions.
A Day in the Life: 
Assist customers with various product related inquiries and parts identification.Process customer orders and purchases with appropriate vendor supply team.Support internal sales team by providing overall technical support and researching options including but not limited to receiving and processing orders, product and service questions, warranty administration and overall customer needs.Secure additional orders through proactive recommendations based on clients' needs.Assist in vendor sales, inventory, purchasing, pricing, and warranty administration.Maintain warehouse inventory accuracy.
Career Growth and Promotion Opportunities: 
Earn the lead responsibility to support and manage 100% of Service department aftermarket needs.Earn a promotion to become ElitAire Parts Store Manager with counter sales. Start-up our inaugural Parts Store including determination of inventory carried, pricing strategy, marketing, and team building. Be responsible for overall store budget and profitability.Earn the long-term opportunity to become the ElitAire Aftermarket Business Leader for the entire territory.
The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, accurate, efficient, and capable of responding to customer needs. Additional requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent technical experience with HVAC Commercial Parts5+ years of HVAC and/or Sales ExperienceExcellent customer service and interpersonal skillsAbility to lift up to 50-lbs with or without an accommodationAbility to operate a powered lift
Join ElitAire, where our commitment to both customers and our team defines our success. We prioritize people and deliver top-notch sales, service, and controls to the commercial and industrial HVAC market across Ohio, Kentucky, and Indiana. Since 2008, we've grown from 7 employees to a thriving team of approximately 95, and we're on a robust trajectory of expansion. 
To learn more about ElitAire, visit our website and our LinkedIn page:
https://elitaire.com/https://www.linkedin.com/company/elitaire/
This is an exciting opportunity to do something extraordinary: Join a growing team that delivers engineered solutions for sustainable design and energy efficient HVAC systems. Come join us by applying online at https://grnh.se/7be43a1b3us or email job@strategichrinc.com!
Employer is EEO/M/F/D/V. Please no third-party candidates or phone calls.

title: Investment Operations Manager
description: POSITIONPosition Title: Investment Operations Manager  Status: Exempt, Full-time, Regular, “At-will” Work StatusSalary Range: $90,000 to $105,000 POSITION SUMMARYAs an Investment Operations Manager, you will play a key role in investment operations by ensuring the efficient and accurate execution of account opening, money movements, investment transactions and compliance procedures. You will work closely with advisors, the Investment Committee, and other team members to facilitate the investment process, manage and develop workflows, and accurately maintain client and transaction records. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in investment operations, excellent attention to detail, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS· Oversee the implementation, reporting, and daily management of the firm's back-office operations, financial processes, client reporting systems, and client service.· Facilitate the opening, tracking, and funding of new investment accounts.· Update appropriate systems with all client communication, activities, and other relevant data.· Support Chief Compliance Officer with day-to-day compliance monitoring and policy implementation.· Complete and/or delegate client requests with the utmost attention to detail in facilitating white-glove level service.· Assist clients with day-to-day money movement needs.· Assist in management of the firm's technology infrastructure and coordinate with third-party service providers such as custodians and technology solutions vendors.· Provide general support to advisors in implementing client financial and investment plans.· Participate in the selection of new team members.· Other duties and tasks, as assigned periodically. SUCCESS FACTORS· Detail-oriented with a high level of personal responsibility.· Demonstrated resourcefulness and problem-solving skills to address complex issues independently.· Takes initiative and works autonomously to identify and resolve operational challenges efficiently. Designs efficient systems and seeks productivity improvements.· Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and complete multiple tasks simultaneously with minimal supervision.· Passionate about helping team members and clients.· Strong process and planning orientation; goal-oriented and task-driven.· Direct communication style with reliable follow-through on commitments.· Balances team needs with firm goals; enjoys collaborating within a team environment.· Ability to delegate tasks effectively.· Positive and outgoing demeanor. WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS· Daily desk work and computer work.· May be required to travel to other facilities. EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION· Four to seven years of operational experience specific to financial planning and investment operations.· Bachelor's Degree required: Finance or Business preferred.· Strong general technology knowledge.Experience with custodian account opening and maintenance platforms such as Schwab Advisor Center or NetX360.Knowledge of necessary financial principles involved in most/all account types, applicable requirements, and basic investment concepts.Extensive knowledge of CRM software and its applications, Salesforce preferred.Experience with portfolio accounting software, Orion preferred. Familiar with billing and reporting concepts such as blended fee schedules, householding, and transaction types.Familiarity with financial planning and account aggregation software, eMoney preferred.Proficiency in Microsoft Office and internet protocols.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

title: Business Development Manager
description: About BlumThe Blum name stands for quality, innovation, and great customer service. We manufacture hardware that makes working in the kitchen and throughout your home easier. Each of our products has been designed carefully, with the customer experience in mind, and research to back them up. We specialize in engineering and manufacturing concealed hinges, drawer systems and systems for lift-up doors. From our touch-to-open technology to the soft-closing door or drawer, our hardware helps modernize the kitchen experience.It is not just a job; it is a way of life. We are here to move your ideas forward.We produce the highest quality products in our industry from start to finish, and every single employee plays a role in that. At Blum, we work in teams and collaborate with colleagues within our family-oriented culture. In our rewarding work environment, we learn something new every day. Join us and grow with us!The OpportunityIn this position as a Business Development Manager, you are required to develop and expand the network of contacts of retailers and various stakeholders in the US furniture industry. With your strong background and connections in the furniture industry in the US and years of experience in SEA (South-East-Asia), preferably Vietnam, you are the direct link between our customers in the US and our teams in Vietnam and other markets in SEA. Due to your strong network within the furniture industry in the US but also in Asia, your industry knowledge and your trustworthy personality, you generate a significant added value for our customers in the US. This position will provide the opportunity to enhance your selling, account management, and hardware knowledge while being part of a professional supportive team and a tremendous and welcoming culture.Responsibilities:First point of contact for Furniture retailers and other relevant stakeholder in the US marketThis position manages and assures flawless execution throughout the customer purchasing process (drawing specification, product consultancy/selection, after-sales support …) at the US side in close collaboration with Blum VietnamWork hand-in-hand with the Blum team in Vietnam, in order to add value for all stakeholders in the US and in SEAShare market insights for better understanding of customer needs and expectations and consult customers with best and most suitable technical solutionsWork to establish a network within the furniture industry that will allow for long-term relationships with new and existing retailers in the US.Network with US buyer representatives in Southeast Asia (SEA).Participate in customer events in the US and Vietnam, such as trade fairs, in-house exhibitions, customer tours, etc.Maintain regular contact with internal and external customers to cultivate strong relationships.Participate in on-the-job Blum product trainings so you can implement all acquired skills to better educate our customers and deliver results.Initiate and provide product training and demonstrations to both retail partners as well as manufacturers.Develop primary knowledge of the marketplace (users, applications, products, competition, and channels) to effectively analyze market potential and communicate competitor market data.Note: Employee's duties and responsibilities are not limited by the above. Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary by the employee’s supervisor. In addition to the basic requirements of the position, all employees are expected to meet the company's goals of continual improvement in the areas of knowledge, skills, processes, quality, and sustainability.Requirements:The applicant should be initiative-taking and a team player with strong organizational, planning and time management skills.Solid experience in the furniture industry in Southeast Asia (SEA), with a focus on Vietnam. This person must understand Vietnam or SEA and must have a close connection to SEA/Vietnam culture/People.Extensive industry knowledge, latest and future market trends, and existing networks in the US luxury furniture retail market, and ideally in the hospitality market as wellIs aware of and understands cultural aspects in different work situations and respects cultural differences.Willing to spend several months in SEA, such as Vietnam and Indonesia for the first 2 years. Afterwards regular visits are required in order to maintain the network with US buyer representatives in Southeast Asia (SEA).Demonstrates sound judgement and deals with conflict with diplomacy.Maintains a willingness to learn and improve.Collaborator that enjoys being and working with others as well as individually (individual or group settings).Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 10 years work experience in furniture industry required.Must have a valid United States driver’s license in your state of residence.Ability to pass a background check, drug screening, and Motor Vehicle Report screening.Ability to work in a variety of environments when meeting with customers and assessing product needs.Capable of lifting and transporting heavy items (up to 50 lbs.) and requesting assistance as needed.Applicant must be MS Office proficient and possess solid analytical skills.CRM experience is a plus.Overnight travel is required however this can vary.Knowledge of the kitchen cabinet industry is a plus but not required.Ability to manage your schedule without constant oversight.Must be an initiative-taker with drive to achieve more each day.Solid teaching skills, along with a strong technical aptitude are required.The ability to maintain a strong customer service focus is necessary. Aptitude to adjust one’s behavior to deal effectively with other people. Blum USA believes in offering their employees an Excellent Benefits Package that includes:Salaried positionPossible Bonus opportunitiesHealth (Medical and Dental)401(k) with employer matchingFlexible spending account to cover eligible out of pocket health, dental and vision expenses.Three weeks of vacation starting your second year on the jobTerm life insurance equal to annual salary at no cost to employeeCompany Vehicle (Fuel, Insurance, Maintenance Included)And more!

title: Safety Coordinator
description:
Join our team and experience all that Robert A. Bothman Construction has to offer!
It's fun to work at a company where people take pride and truly believe in what they're doing. At Bothman, we're committed to bringing passion and superior customer focus to all of our innovative construction projects. Although we work hard, and we're serious about what we do - we care deeply about our employees and like to have a good time too. In fact, our core principle is Quality People and Quality Projects TM. Here’s a glimpse of some of the coolest projects we’ve worked on: Avaya Stadium (Home to the San Jose Earthquakes), the Mountain Winery in Saratoga, San Jose State University Event Center, Cupertino City Center Park, the Haunted House at the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk and the Guadalupe River Park to name a few. If a career at Bothman Construction sounds interesting to you, please read on!
The Safety Coordinator is responsible for assisting in the implementation of loss controls systems and safety programs designed to prevent accidents and harm to personnel, property, and general public.
In this role, you'll be utilizing your safety compliance and construction standard knowledge to provide the following support:
Manage and maintain current Employee Safety files.Keep safety training and certificate log up to date.Participate in monthly Safety Committee Meetings.Ensure compliance with the company’s guideline and those set by Federal and State agencies.Ability to develop and deliver safety training.Perform periodic jobsite inspections and prepare observation reports.File all reports in a timely manner. See that corrective action is taken immediately.Assists in the preparation and maintenance of specific project safety, health, and environmental procedures and policies.Assist with Job Specific Safety Plan’s to include all hazards / tasks required to meet project safety guidelines / requirements.Motivate employees to follow safety culture.A proactive approach to maintaining zero injuries in the workplace.Maintain safety credentials (Certified Health and Safety Technician (CHST), OSHA30, HAZWOPER 40, etc).
Preferred Qualifications:
Must have working knowledge of OSHA Regulations and other Construction Industry Safety standards.Effectively be able to communicate safety and health hazards to all.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.5+ years of experience in the area of construction safety.Hands-on experience with Windows, Excel, and Word.Bilingual – English and Spanish, preferred.A minimum of OSHA 30-hour training, First Aid/CPR/and AED trainingDemonstrated knowledge of safety/environmental principles and techniques is required.In addition, achievement of CHST is required within two years of appointment to this position.Demonstrated management, leadership, and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate well both verbally and in writing and train others.Demonstrated computer skills and experience with Microsoft Office suite programs.Performing this job requires use of hands to handle or feel objects, tools, or controls, sit, talk, stand, climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl.Employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
We offer excellent benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401K and competitive salary. E.O.E.
Must be authorized to work in the U.S.
Robert A. Bothman complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.
