title: Senior Manager, Application Development
description:
Ready to take a different path? Passionate about Technology? Love horse racing? Eager to work in a rapidly growing gaming industry? Fascinated by the world of gambling and casinos? If you answered YES to any of these questions, 1/ST TECHNOLOGY could be the right fit for you!
Background of Business: 1/ST Technology is a fully integrated racing and gaming technology company providing solutions that drive pari-mutuel and fixed odds wagering around the globe. Leading technology and services provider to the North American pari-mutuel wagering market, with services that include the horse racing industry’s most comprehensive and user-friendly wagering website/platform allowing customers to wager from a computer, phone or mobile device. Ongoing commitment to the growth and success of the global racing industry through B2C and B2B product innovation, extensive professional services offerings, the broadest integration of hosts for commingled pari-mutuel and fixed odds and the continued evolution of the preeminent totalizator systems in the world.
The Senior Application Development Manager (B2C) position leads, mentors and provides hands-on senior level support for the company’s software product offerings. This role ensures the Development teams have the information and tools needed to complete deliverables. This position is a vital source of online application development domain knowledge, front-end and backend functionality knowledge along with communication and support among all B2C product lines. This position acts as a bridge among Development, Quality Assurance and Product Management teams to foster a team-based approach that delivers high quality software. The Senor Application Development Manager demonstrates leadership, coaching and mentoring skills combined with the flexibility of working in a dynamic, fast-moving and fast-growing product development environment.
The position’s competencies include but are not limited to the following: Active Listening, Business Acumen; Comprehension; Confidentiality; Continuous Improvement; Customer Focus; Creativity; Communication Proficiency; Dependability; Decision Making; Flexibility, Integrity (fostering trust and a positive work environment); Innovation (bringing creativity to the workplace); Organizational Skills; Personal Effectiveness & Credibility; Problem Solving & Analysis; Project Management, Punctuality, Relationship Development; Results Driven; Self-Assurance; Strategic Awareness; Tactical “Know-How”; Technology Skills; Time Management and Teamwork Orientation.
Manages Development teams across multiple product lines.Implements policies and procedures for quality and personal standards.Monitors and audits processes and performance.Works with the teams to enhance and refine feature requests.Collaborates with multiple teams to ensure that feature enhancements are well defined and cross-team dependencies are addressed.Provides hands-on coaching, support and training to all staff.Advises on Development workforce planning needs.Advises and manages external outsourcing for workforce planning on an as needed basis.Partners with Recruitment for workforce planning and active recruitment efforts, including but not limited to: position descriptions, postings, calibration with external sourcing avenues and recruitment firms, interviewing and employment offer process steps leading to Onboarding activities.Provides day-to-day production support for back-end systems, as needed.Works with third-party vendors to implement functionality and maintain relationships.Communicates plans and prepares leaders to communicate within department structuresPerforms other duties as assigned.
10+ years of experience in Software Development with a high percentage focus on web application development5+ years of experience as a Software Development Lead or Manager with preference given to candidates that have focused on e-commerce, online gaming/trading with mobile application developmentAbility to multitask between several projects.Experience working on all aspects of Software Development, including Requirements, Design, Development, Testing, UAT, Deployment, and End User Support.Excellent skills in collaboration, communication and working well with teams across the organizationProficient with cross-functional collaboration – strong in forging relationships across groups and driving buy-in and commitment towards solutions that may be challenging or new. Experience building teams from the ground upAbility to mentor, coach, lead and develop talent in a dynamic environment in order to build the required capabilities and to attract and retain the best talent.Experience in and working with Quality Assurance teams.Self-starter, self-motivator, detail-oriented, highly organized. Motivated to excel, competitive in nature and does not confuse “efforts” with “results”. Strong change leader and relationship builder.Confident and capable of respectfully engaging in positive, driven and motivating dialogue with department team members, employees and stakeholders. Ability to work on a team and as an individual contributor. Entrepreneurial, ambitious (takes initiative and personal ownership/accountability) and strong ‘integrator’ (innately knows when to share information and/or to bring parties/business units together).Individual must be open to learn about and understand ‘niche’ industry.Demonstrates and maintains flexibility and adapts to changes within industry and company.Experience with workforce planning and budgeting requirementsPreferred Experience and/or Education: Knowledgeable in technology, horse racing, pari-mutuel wagering, gaming, sports wagering and/or experience in a start-up environment
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:This position does have supervisory/managerial responsibilities for Development teams and Contractors within and outside of the United States along with enhancing workforce planning for projects on an as-needed basis. This position is empowered to take initiative with applicable duties/projects Requires travel up to 15% including travel outside of local area and can include overnight stay. International travel possible.Compensation is commensurate with experience and includes a competitive base salary, bonus opportunity and benefitsBase Work Location – Position can be based in the Hunt Valley, MD or Washington, PA office locations. Position classification is Remote Work.

title: Sr Material Handler
description:
Want to see more? Find all job opportunities for both BioFire and bioMérieux worldwide by clicking here.

Description

Benefits at bioMerieux: 

Sign on bonus of $1200 to be paid at 60 days of employment

Low-cost medical, dental, and vision benefits starting day one

11 paid holidays

160 hours of paid time off

Annual bonus

9.5% 401k company contribution with no vesting period

Tuition reimbursement up to $10000 per calendar year

Onsite cafeteria with daily food stipend

Starting pay is $17.50/hr. Day shift hours (6:00 am - 2:30 pm OR 9:00 am to 5:30 pm)

The Sr Material Handler performs all shipping, material movement and receiving duties and confirms inventory levels. This job directly affects both internal and external customers. It also affects Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and Quality goals of the division. Routine internal contacts may include, but not limited to Sales Administration, Maintenance, Engineering, Quality, Material handling and Planning.

Primary Duties

Pulls and packs product orders to ensure accuracy and efficiencies. Checks lot numbers; package weights and prepares carrier documentation. Receives and processes product from manufacturing or suppliers. Ensures parts are properly identified and labeled. Stocks product after approval for use in a manner to maintain 5S, inventory accuracy and safety. Counts physical inventory of all raw materials and finished goods in the warehouses and coolers. Processes all required paperwork to ensure the material transactions occur for all departmental activities. Maintains warehouse and work areas following 5S principles; participates 5S audits as needed. Follows all departmental and company safety policies including maintaining warehouse and work areas following 5S principles. Work with the department Associate Team Leaders and Team Leaders to ensure compliance with all cGMP, ISO and FDA guidelines for warehouse activities. May need to drive a truck for material transport of product from one location to another. Provides training to others within the department. Identifies areas that need improvement within the department to assist in maximizing accuracy, minimizing errors and increasing inventory accuracy of all parts processed. 

Knowledge, Experience And Skills

High school diploma or GED with 2+ years of experience in a shipping and/or receiving environment and/or data entry experience. Must be proficient in the use of computers to enter and retrieve data. Must possess clear written and verbal communication skills. Must possess attention to detail and organizational skills, and have the ability to work and communicate effectively with others. Experience with the safe and efficient use material handling equipment such as a floor jack, hand truck, order picker, and forklift is preferred. Truck driving experience is preferred.

maintains and promotes the highest standards of integrity, ethics and compliance.Servant Leadership• Acts as an altruistic servant leader and is consistently humble, self-aware, honest, and transparent.Embrace ChangeCuriosity & Courage• Demonstrates curiosity and a growth mindset; fosters an environment that supports learning, innovation, and intelligent risk-taking; and exhibits resilience in the face of setbacks.Digital Transformation & Change• Seeks and implements continuous improvements and encourages the team to leverage new digital tools and ways of working.Deliver for the CustomerCustomer Focus• Delivers expected business results while putting the customer first and consistently applying an omni-merchant mindset and the EDLP and EDLC business models to all plans.Strategic Thinking• Adopts a holistic perspective that considers data, analytics, customer insights, and different parts of the business when making plans and shaping the team’s strategy.Focus on our AssociatesDiversity, Equity & Inclusion• Identifies, attracts, and retains diverse and inclusive team members; title: Business Lending Specialist
description:
Location: N.Y. - Multiple Locations - Monroe, Wayne, and Ontario Counties*Shift/Hours: Full-time based on business needs.
General Summary:
Reliant Community Federal Credit Union, ranked one of Rochester's top mid-sized companies six years in a row, is seeking a Business Lending Specialist to join our team.
The Business Lending Specialist is responsible for developing and originating business lending at the credit union and achieving defined production goals. This includes working one on one with members and potential members to meet their business lending needs
Reliant offers an excellent work environment based on Accountability, Respect, and Teamwork (ART), along with an exceptional benefits package, including:Ability to work remotely401k retirement plan with up to a 4% employer match, plus a 3% safe harbor contributionAffordable Insurance (as little as $5/month!)Generous Paid Time OffBranded ApparelCompetitive Wages
As a Business Lending Specialist at Reliant, you will:Develops new business leads obtained from referrals and a sales calling plan to generate qualified loan and deposit relationships. Interviews loan applicants to gather information necessary to analyze the loan request and business needs.Serves as the contact point for business clients on all member service issues. Cross-sells products and services that meet their needs. Maintains level of service that promotes referrals from satisfied members. Coordinates marketing efforts with branch staff and Marketing Department, including joint calling activity for referrals with staff who made the referral.Reviews business credit applications and financial statements to determine the borrowing capacity, cash flow, capitalization, and collateral value for the business/borrower. Assists in analysis of financial statements to determine cash flow, liquidity, and trends of the business in order for the credit union to make a sound underwriting decision.Investigates the credit history of the applicant/business which includes but is not limited to credit bureau reports, rating from business creditors and suppliers, and income/employment verification.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Knowledge of commercial/business lending and business relationship development activities by possessing experience in commercial credit processing, underwriting, and sales calling activities.Thorough knowledge of all credit union, state and federal policies, procedures and laws regarding lending.Demonstrates flexibility and ability to work in a volume-oriented environment.Work schedule may require evening/weekend hours, business visits, and availability to meet with members at locations convenient to them.Possesses interpersonal skills necessary to resolve complex situations regarding commercial credit situations and needs.
Position Qualifications:5+ years of experience in commercial lending in a financial institution preferred.Knowledge and experience in SBA lending programs desired.High school diploma or equivalent required; college degree preferred.
Physical Requirements:Use keyboard, monitor, telephone, and other standard office equipment.Ability to travel within the Credit Union's geographic service area, with a valid NYS driver's license and dependable transportation.

title: Sr. Financial Analyst
description:
Position Summary: 
As the Sr. Financial Analyst of a nature-based solutions company committed to developing high-quality voluntary carbon offset projects you will play an essential role in supporting Executive team members to make strategic decisions across Chestnut Carbon. This role will provide support across key initiatives such as financial modeling, fundraising, market research, due diligence, and more. This role will be integral in our fast-paced growth over the next few years and beyond, which may include a public offering. This role is for someone who enjoys being challenged and will thrive in a dynamic and ever-changing environment. You will have significant exposure to senior leaders including the CEO, CFO and other key stakeholders across the business and finance functions at Chestnut Carbon and our financial sponsor, Kimmeridge.Chestnut was founded and backed by Kimmeridge, a US-based private equity firm with offices in New York and Denver. The role is based in New York, NY, Chestnut’s headquarters. The role is expected to be in person with modest travel. 
Responsibilities:
Play a key role in supporting our consolidated strategic and financial planning processes, and evolving the underlying integrated financial forecast models, systems, and tools.Develop a strong understanding of our company, strategy, and industry.Support fundraising and financing activities by building and maintaining long-term financial models, debt structure, scenario planning forecasts and Board materials.Act as a liaison between stakeholders across the business to drive the execution of Chestnut Carbon’s corporate goals.Collaborate across the organization to overcome problem areas/features.Utilize financial modeling skills to determine financial viability of early-stage projects in Chestnut’s development pipeline.Help screen potential M&A opportunities and provide valuation analysis for senior management.Gather information, identify linkages/trends and apply findings to analyses.Assist in the delivery of strategy projects and provide clear transparency on progress ensuring effective communication across senior leaders at Chestnut Carbon and other key stakeholders.Support on market research and competitive benchmarking. 
Desired Qualifications and Experiences:
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Accounting or related discipline; MBA a plus.3+ years of related experience in corporate finance and/or FP&A, corporate development, venture capital/private equity, capital markets, and clean/renewable energy, specifically in investment banking, corporate planning or equivalent.Excellent financial modeling skills with strong knowledge of financial statements.Project and/or corporate finance deal experience preferred.Prior experience/knowledge of real estate transactions a plus. 
Skills & Attributes:
Strong analytical skills with high proficiency in financial modeling (Excel), including the ability to model complex debt structures, and data analysis tools.Highly organized, with the initiative and ability to work with limited supervision.Effective process management abilities.Strong communication skills within all levels of the organization, including verbal, written and nonverbal communication, ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.Able to work independently and on a team in a fast-paced and high-volume environment with emphasis on accuracy and timeliness.Deep intellectual curiosity with a desire to constantly learn and grow.Strong work ethic, positive attitude, and attention to detail with the ability to work in a tight timeframe and shift priorities as needed.Ability to think strategically about implications of allocating capital across different opportunity sets with a focus on maximizing value for the company.Hands-on, roll-up your sleeves mentality, mentally agile and able to be both strategic and tactical.Must be a self-starter, willing to step up where needed across a flat and dynamic organization.Builds trusted, collaborative relationships at all levels of the organization and across different teams, divisions and locations.Demonstrates a high degree of commercial and strategic acumen.Is adaptable, resilient, and comfortable with ambiguity and complexity.Passionate about sustainability.Ability to thrive in a high growth and fast-paced environment, work well under deadlines and adapt to changing business priorities.Strong team-building skills, adept at forging positive relationships across the business.Some domestic travel (~5%) required.Authorized to work in the United States.
Location:
New York, New York (headquarters).Candidate must be willing to live in the New York City area full-time and work in-person in the New York office. 
Salary and Benefits:The base salary for this position is expected to be between $110,000 and $140,000, subject to the chosen candidate’s experience and qualifications, determination of which is made in the sole discretion of Chestnut Carbon.
All employees are eligible to participate in health, insurance, and 401K plan benefits on their first day of employment. Chestnut Carbon pays 100% of the cost of the employees’ health/dental/vision insurance. During each fiscal year of employment, employees will be eligible to earn a discretionary annual incentive bonus, based on company and individual performance targets.
Diversity, equity, and inclusion are central to everything we do. Chestnut Carbon thrives on and celebrates different views, beliefs, and values. We are committed to our talented team and partners, regardless of background or affiliation, and to actively promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion throughout our business. We strive to be a place where you can be you and bring yourself to work. Chestnut Carbon is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to affirmative action planning and encourages diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, gender, age, religion, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation, genetic information, veteran, or marital status.

title: Oracle Integration Developer
description:
About the DepartmentITS collaborates with campus partners to support the mission of the University of Chicago through the consistent delivery of high-quality solutions and services. We provide secure, stable, and reliable infrastructure and applications to support the mission of the University. We support and enable faculty research and teaching with the effective use of technology. We simplify the technology experience for faculty, students, alumni, and staff, and we ensure technology is mobile-friendly and accessible. We identify, manage, and mitigate the technology risks of the University. 
Job SummaryThe University of Chicago is seeking an Integration Developer in the implementation and support of our platform, Oracle Cloud ERP. The role of an Integration Developer involves working with business analysts, project managers, and other stakeholders to identify integration requirements and develop solutions that enable the seamless flow of data between Oracle Cloud ERP and other systems. The person in this role must have a deep understanding of Oracle Cloud ERP's architecture, data model, and APIs, as well as expertise in integration technologies and protocols.
ResponsibilitiesDesigns and develops integrations between Oracle Cloud ERP and other systems, such as Salesforce, Workday, or SAP. Develops and maintains integration interfaces using Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC) or other middleware technologies such as MuleSoft. Supports process improvements and changes to integration methodology based on prior implementation experience. Assists other integration developers in mitigating risks and resolving technical issues, including performance and data quality problems.Applies defined coding standards to all integration development activities. Contributes to establishing integration and data standards, and maintains efficient operationalization of all integration solutions, including error handling. Configures and customizes Oracle Cloud ERP to enable seamless data integration. Develops and tests integration workflows, mappings, and transformations. Troubleshoots and resolves integration issues, including errors and exceptions. Ensures integration solutions are scalable, secure, and meet performance requirements. Provides specialized knowledge of Oracle and MuleSoft integration work. Investigates, analyzes and resolves day-to-day technical problems using standard procedures.Supports and maintains existing applications. Works with web developers and responds to requests from users.Performs other related work as needed.
Minimum QualificationsEducation:Minimum requirements include a college or university degree in related field.
Work Experience:Minimum requirements include knowledge and skills developed through 2-5 years of work experience in a related job discipline.
Preferred QualificationsEducation:Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, or other related field. Master’s degree. 
Experience: A minimum of 3 years development, implementation, support, and maintenance of a vendor-supported system.A minimum of 3 years as a MuleSoft developer supporting production systems troubleshooting within the Mule Runtime, Platform API, and Gateway tools.A minimum of 3 years of experience with Service Oriented Architecture (SOA).A minimum of 3 years of experience working with databases and data integrity. A minimum of 3 years of experience in data mapping and metadata concepts.
Certifications:Oracle Cloud certification.
Technical Skills or Knowledge:Hands-on experience developing Integrations between Oracle Cloud ERP and other applications.Strong analytical skills used to translate information and requirements into documentation and solution design.Functional knowledge of Oracle Cloud ERP is a plus.
Preferred CompetenciesTechnical direction – effectively assist leadership in managing a technical direction for the organization by keeping up with industry trends and recommending forward paths.Focus on delivering high-quality service, needs of the key stakeholders, end-users, service orientation, organizational communications, and getting results.Listening and Communications – build partnerships/relationships through listening for understanding. Express oneself effectively in all media, with diplomacy, openness, and transparency. Provide specific and appropriate feedback.Accountable, Commitment, and Follow-Through – do what you say you will do and personally responsible for your actions. Take individual responsibility for performance including quality and quantity of work. Willing to own the issue, problem, activity, and accomplishments. Commit to own development. Initiative and Innovation – proactive approach and interest in problem-solving. Display a creative approach to everyday problems, ask good questions, and stimulate ideas. Offer creative ideas for improvements and solutions to problems. Keep abreast of IT trends and technologies and build knowledge and technical expertise.Collaborative – build effective relationships with others. Work effectively as a member of a department and/or project team. Open to assistance and willing to assist others. Put the success of the team above your own interest.Professional – internalize and act on organizational mission and goals. Work effectively across the organization and campus community. Active interest in the University and IT in higher education. Take personal ownership of professional development. Value and respect differences.Decision-making / Problem solving – generate pragmatic approaches to addressing issues, challenges, and opportunities. Analyze problems. Develop and implement effective solutions. Make sound business decisions in a timely manner.Strong analytical skills.Strong oral and written communication skills.
Working ConditionsHybrid work schedule.
Application DocumentsResume/CV (required)Cover Letter (required)
When applying, the document(s) MUST be uploaded via the My Experience page, in the section titled Application Documents of the application.
Posting StatementThe University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity/Disabled/Veterans and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information please see the University's Notice of Nondiscrimination. Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call 773-702-5800 or submit a request via Applicant Inquiry Form. We seek a diverse pool of applicants who wish to join an academic community that places the highest value on rigorous inquiry and encourages a diversity of perspectives, experiences, groups of individuals, and ideas to inform and stimulate intellectual challenge, engagement, and exchange. All offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes a review of conviction history. A conviction does not automatically preclude University employment. Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position. The University of Chicago's Annual Security & Fire Safety Report (Report) provides information about University offices and programs that provide safety support, crime and fire statistics, emergency response and communications plans, and other policies and information. The Report can be accessed online at: http://securityreport.uchicago.edu. Paper copies of the Report are available, upon request, from the University of Chicago Police Department, 850 E. 61st Street, Chicago, IL 60637.

title: Healthcare Recruiter (Entry-level)
description:
Launched in 2000, Eight Eleven Group committed to 100% organic growth, exclusively promoting from within, while always keeping culture and growth opportunity at the forefront of the business model. What began as a two-person Indianapolis startup, Eight Eleven Group has rapidly expanded to become a market-leading organization within one of the fastest growing industries today: Consulting and Professional Services.   In 2012, Medasource was established to provide niche services exclusively in the Healthcare industry, including these practice areas: Providers, Payers, Government, and Life Sciences (pharma, device, diagnostic, clinical research, commercial labs, consumer goods, food sciences, chemicals, agriculture, and environmental sciences). Our team takes a consultative, solution-driven approach with Fortune 500 and enterprise non-profit clients to help them deliver and execute complex capital and operational projects. We are not just in the business of professional services - we are in the business of making a meaningful and authentic impact both internally with our high-performing team and externally with our clients and consultants.  RESPONSIBILITIES As a Medasource Recruiter, you will build out talent networks of long-lasting, personal, and professional relationships with potential consultants. We create a next-level experience through the hiring process as they source and screen for qualified candidates to match them with opportunities where they can succeed. Recruiters advocate for their candidates, are accessible, genuine, and take the time to understand how they can add value to their job search and interview process. Our Recruiters bring value to our clients by offering them flexibility of timeline and finding them top talent at a rapid pace. Here’s what you will do: Collaborate with our sales team to determine the client’s hiring needs Help develop a strategy to identify niche-skilled candidates that meet expectations Qualify candidates through an intensive internal interview process before presenting candidate to external clients. This includes phone, in-person, and virtual interviews Assess applicants' knowledge, skills, and experience to best suit open positions Provide resume coaching, mock interviewing, job offer assistance, and interview feedback to candidates Handle a variety of activities daily, as well as the challenge of new problems and new ventures Provide extensive onboarding and post-placement support to create raving fans in our consultants throughout the duration of their project assignments with our clients Consistently hit their weekly metric goals of phone calls, interviews, and placements Set personal and team goals through frequent goals sessions with your manager and recruiter support 
BENEFITS & PERKS Base salary + uncapped commission structure 401K match program Full slate of benefits, including health, dental, vision plans, and HSA Paid holidays Paid vacation, sick, and personal days Eight Eleven’s BeGiving Program: 8 hours per quarter for service work/volunteering Access to Eight Eleven University: Internal personal & professional development program All-expenses-paid Reward Trip each year for top producers and a guest Top-notch training programs at every step in your career Access to a personal financial concierge Genuine, passionate, family-oriented culture  WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED Competitive, motivated spirit and desire to succeed Outstanding communication skills and innate ability to connect with people Innovative and entrepreneurial spirit with the desire to learn and grow Results-driven, forward-thinking, problem-solving mindset Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, positive and ever-changing work environment Lively interest in the technical aspects of the work Bachelor’s Degree 
EEO STATEMENTEight Eleven Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, disability, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

title: Electronic Technician II
company_name: Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental Services
description:
Title: Electronic Technician II

State Role Title: Equipment Service and Repair Technician I

Hiring Range: Commensurate with Experience

Pay Band: 3

Agency: Dept Behavioral Health/Develop

Location: Piedmont Geriatric Hospital

Agency Website: https://pgh.dbhds.virginia.gov

Recruitment Type: General Public - G

Job Duties

Piedmont Geriatric Hospital (PGH) and Virginia Center for Behavioral Rehabilitation (VCBR) is recruiting for an Electronic Technician II (Equipment Service and Repair Technician I) to serve the following campuses as shared services:

Piedmont Geriatric Hospital (PGH), located in Burkeville, Virginia is a 123-bed, gero-psychiatric hospital, operated by the Virginia Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental Services (DBHDS).

The Virginia Center for Behavioral Rehabilitation (VCBR), located in Burkeville, VA is a behavioral treatment center recognized for its excellence by securely housing and treating civilly committed sex offenders. VCBR provides recovery, opportunity and support to residents so they may safely return to their communities and is the only facility in the Commonwealth that provides such service.

The Electronic Technician II's role is to provide a central point of contact for operation of all security doors, gates, pipe chase doors, and office doors. This includes preventative maintenance on all doors and locks throughout the facility. This position will also serve on the Security Systems team to help troubleshoot issues with door controls and door positioning switches. Assist with repair of locks.

Minimum Qualifications

 Extensive knowledge of operational and maintenance procedures for commercial structures Knowledge of secure access control systems Ability to communicate effectively both oral and written Analytical problem-solving skills for troubleshooting complex technical problems Knowledge of mechanical, electrical, and electronic security systems Knowledge of lock and lock system construction and operation Knowledge of Door Sliders and components Knowledge of low voltage power controls

Additional Considerations

 Considerable experience working in secured facility

Special Instructions

You will be provided a confirmation of receipt when your application and/or résumé is submitted successfully. Please refer to “Your Application” in your account to check the status of your application for this position.

Piedmont Geriatric Hospital only accepts online applications via PAGEUP. Resumes and other documents may accompany the application but will not serve as a substitute for an application. Faxed, e-mailed or mailed applications will not be accepted. Please refer to your PAGEUP account for the status of your application and this position. This posting will remain open for a minimum of five (5) business days.

Piedmont Geriatric Hospital offers a comprehensive benefit package to include your choice of four health insurance plans, paid life insurance and retirement plans, 12 paid holidays, annual and sick leave.

Commonwealth’s Alternate Hiring Process: In support of the Commonwealth’s commitment to inclusion, we are encouraging individuals with disabilities to apply through the Commonwealth Alternative Hiring Process. To be considered for this opportunity, applicants will need to provide their Certificate of Disability (COD) provided by a Certified Rehabilitation Counselor within the Department for Aging & Rehabilitative Services (DARS). Veterans are encouraged to answer Veteran status questions and submit their disability documentation, if applicable, to DARS to get their Certificate of Disability. If you need to get a Certificate of Disability, use this link: https://www.vadars.org/drs/cpid/PWContact.aspx , or call DARS at 800-552-5019.

Reasonable accommodations are available to persons with disabilities during application and/or interview processes per the Americans with Disabilities Act. Contact Human Resources at (804-518-3339) for assistance. Minorities, Individuals with disabilities, Veterans, and people with National Service experience are encouraged to apply. EEO/AA/TTY.

Piedmont Geriatric Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment opportunities are open to all regardless of race, sex, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, political affiliation, genetics or disability.

DBHDS is a healthcare organization and must comply with the federal Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (federal CMS) guidance on Omnibus COVID-19 Health Care staff Vaccination Regulation which requires vaccination of all employees or an exemption. A job offer of employment is contingent upon the candidate meeting these guidelines as a condition of employment.

Contact Information

Name: Shanon Gardner

Phone: 804-766-3326

Email: shanon.gardner@dbhds.virginia.gov

In support of the Commonwealth’s commitment to inclusion, we are encouraging individuals with disabilities to apply through the Commonwealth Alternative Hiring Process. To be considered for this opportunity, applicants will need to provide their AHP Letter (formerly COD) provided by the Department for Aging & Rehabilitative Services (DARS), or the Department for the Blind & Vision Impaired (DBVI). Service-Connected Veterans are encouraged to answer Veteran status questions and submit their disability documentation, if applicable, to DARS/DBVI to get their AHP Letter. Requesting an AHP Letter can be found at AHP Letter or by calling DARS at 800-552-5019.

Note: Applicants who received a Certificate of Disability from DARS or DBVI dated between April 1, 2022- February 29, 2024, can still use that COD as applicable documentation for the Alternative Hiring Process.

title: Director of Client Services
description:
Be a brand ambassador—represent Valiant’s Residential multifamily management platform locally and nationally and personify Valiant Residential's values of being inclusive, driven, collaborative, and insightful.
As the Director of Client Services, you will report to the V.P. of Client Services and be responsible for leading, assisting, and executing strategies to expand our client base and enhance overall client satisfaction. 
This role involves a combination of business development, relationship management, strategic planning, and marketing. 
To be successful in this role it demands a deep understanding of the multifamily industry, a proven track record in client hunting, and strategic prospecting to expand our client base and drive revenue growth.
 This role is based at Valiant Residential HQ in Dallas, TX. 
Business DevelopmentDevelop and nurture relationships with local developers, ownership groups as well as national institutional investors to support their growth efforts and relationship with Valiant Residential. Identify and pursue business opportunities to expand on client portfolio through email marketing, cold calling, and networking through industry contacts.Maintain a strong sales pipeline.Cultivate and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships. Build and manage a pipeline of new multifamily property management prospects for the region or state.Act as the primary point of contact for key clients through the sales and transition process and then maintain a strong relationship as a compliment to the operations team.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless delivery of services to clients.
Multifamily Market ExpertiseDemonstrate in-depth knowledge of multifamily underwriting, property valuations, and the property management market, including trends, challenges, and opportunities.Leverage prior experience in multifamily to tailor solutions that meet the specific needs of clients in this sector.Stay informed about industry developments to provide strategic insights for business growth.Develop strategic plans to position the company competitively in the market.Work closely with the executive team to align business development goals with overall company objective
Team LeadershipWorking under the V.P. will bring a lot of opportunities to lead, mentor, and inspire a high-performing client services and analyst teamCreate and improve upon processes in place with CRM, systems, and client procurement Foster a collaborative and results-driven culture within the team.Coordinate with internal operations leaders to support client contract negotiations.
QualificationsBachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, or a related fieldProven track record of successful client acquisition within the multifamily property management industry.In-depth understanding of multifamily property management trends and market dynamics.Excellent communication and negotiation skills.Strategic thinker with the ability to make data-driven decisions.Ability to travel as needed but not more than approximately 10% of the time
Experience  Minimum 4 years of third-party multifamily management and sales experienceMinimum 4 years of underwriting and property valuationsProven track record of relationship-building with institutional and private ownersInternally motivated self-starter“Passion for the pursuit” – enjoys and thrives on winning new business.Ability to solve problems quickly, handle multiple tasks, and organize resources in support of complex client and internal deliverables.
BenefitsAs a Valiant Residential team member, you’ll enjoy exciting benefits including:
401(k) Retirement Plan Options with Employer MatchComprehensive Medical Benefits including Vision & Dental (HSA Plan free for employees) Generous Vacation & Sick Time PolicyAward-Winning Culture & Employee Engagement ProgramsIf you are a strategic thinker passionate about driving business growth and fostering client relationships, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

title: Supply Chain Master Scheduler
description:
Location: Falconer, NY

Salary Range: $64,000 to $77,000

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Summary

SKF Aerospace is a first-tier supplier to the global aviation industry and much more. We design & manufacture complex, high performance, high-value bearings in steel and advanced ceramics. Our production group, technologies, & products are at the heart of aerospace industry and the world’s leading aircraft jet engine & gearbox manufacturers at our Falconer, NY location. The Master Scheduler will coordinate schedules and inventories to ensure efficient and effective operation of the assigned department or facility.

Responsibilities

Serve as a primary point of contact for and liaison with sales, logistics, and manufacturing departments. Collaborate with these departments to establish schedules and plans that allocate available resources to best serve client or customer needs. Periodically compares current and anticipated orders with available inventory of raw materials. Use judgment to anticipate demand for and to acquire additional supplies as needed. Negotiate with outside supply vendors. Ensure accurate and timely delivery of orders. Integrate sales orders with master schedule. Coordinate availability of raw materials, supplies, equipment, and staff as needed to meet delivery dates. Maintain master distribution schedule for the assigned facility. Revises as needed and alerts appropriate staff of schedule changes or delays. Participate in periodic forecasting meetings with sales, marketing, and other related departments. Lead additional planning meetings with sales, production, shipping, purchasing, and customer service staff. Performs other related duties, as required. 

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain or Business Administration or a related field required. At least five years of related experience in a manufacturing or similar environment required. Extremely proficient with production planning systems, such as MRP II. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Thorough understanding of the business and supply chain. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Professional certification by the American Production and Inventory Control Society (APICS) preferred. 

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health.

Diversity in the Workplace. At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement, and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Supply Chain Manager

Location: Falconer, NY

Job ID: 19689

Salary Range: $64,000 to $77,000

SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

title: Regional Finance Process Manager
description:
Location: Blue Bell, PA

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030. 

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

SKF has established a regional finance support structure in the Americas, based in Blue Bell, PA, supporting SKF Finance Operations Centers (FOC’s) in North America (NAM) and Latin America (LAM). At SKF Finance has have a powerful role related to a lean, efficient, and digital environment, and we are aiming to be in the frontline of next generation Business Finance.

The Finance Operations Centers at SKF in the Americas includes Accounting & Reporting (Record to Report – R2R), Accounts Payable (Procure to Pay – P2P), Accounts Receivable (Order to Cash – O2C), Central Controlling, Internal Control, and Finance Processes. Finance Operations Americas has two FOC’s located in Blue Bell, USA and Puebla, MX.

As a Finance Regional Process Manager in the AMER region, you will be part of the Regional Support Americas team and report to the Finance Support Manager Americas, part of the Global Finance Operations & Development organization. You will be responsible for overall Finance process governance within SKF Finance process guidelines, framework, and tools in process scope, providing support to FOC’s teams in the region. This position will also be part of the implementation team of the SAP Finance module as part of the Americas SEP project and other finance-related system implementations and process improvement activities.

Responsibilities

Accountable for implementation of process changes within the process scope, responsible for identifying topics for cross-process alignment.Identify business requirements and how these impact process design.Identify improvement opportunities and drive continuous improvement, optimization, and automation of process.Identify the competencies needed and develop competency development plan.Support implementation of defined process measurements (KPIs), evaluate and suggest process fixes to improve results.Provide problem resolution support for Finance applications issues.Support Master Data Management in scope.Work together with IT teams to perform process and system evaluations to improve business operations.New systems and processes: testing, evaluation, and modification of local procedures when applicablePerform on-site and remote/online training on the Finance applications.Support audits (Tax, Accounting, SICS, Government)Be a Key User of the Finance applications in scope.Be a team player and cooperate across processes and organizations.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in accounting.Seven or more years of experience within Finance and Accounting functions/department.Understanding of Finance processes and process development, and expertise of processes in own process scope.Process deployment, project and change management skills.Driving business needs management.Service-oriented approach, good communication, negotiation, networking, and teaming skills.Continuous improvement mindset, capability to facilitate and drive change within a global organization.Hands-on experience with Finance applications (SAP, Blackline, Cadency).Strong analytical and PC skills (O365, Excel, Power BI, etc.).

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health. Flexible work options available, depending on role.

Diversity in the Workplace. At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement, and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Manager Finance Support

Location: Blue Bell, PA

Job ID: 19647

title: Accounts Receivable Manager
description:
Accounts Receivable ManagerArizona State UniversityStudent Business ServicesCampus: Tempe100420BR
Job Description
Student Business Services is seeking an Accounts Receivable Manager to support and provide leadership to the Third-Party billing team within the department. Oversees and reviews works of third party sponsor accounting staff to ensure accuracy and billing deadlines are maintained. Reviews and approves routine accounting transactions and manages billing processes within the university A/R billing system. Communicates regularly with third party sponsors and students relating to financial account information often addressing escalated cases. Qualified candidate will possess management experience and an applicable accounting background with the ability to analyze and interpret data for trends or discrepancies.
A successful candidate, not presently employed within Financial Services, will be paid a signing bonus of $750 and a $1,250 bonus after completing six months of employment with the department
Salary Range$74,000 per year
Close Date24-April-2024
Essential Duties
Oversees and manages daily inquiries received in customer service system to ensure accurate and timely responses are provided by team staff.Develops and prepares reporting based on query results from University Data Warehouse tables.Researches, analyzes and uses independent judgment in a variety of daily and non-routine decisions affecting third party group and department.Provides internal/external training both orally and in writing on accounting systems, procedures and practices.Reviews and approves work of team staff and effectively communicating when errors exist.Works with upper management to review potential third party sponsors and identify methods to fulfill billing requirements.Reconciles various accounts to ensure accurate accounting.Advises administrative management on procedures and suggesting process improvements to increase efficiency and accuracy. Performs daily system processes and functions for billing and reporting purposes. Provides technical advice and services to third party accounting staff with problems, complex issues or special projects. Reviews and controls account and records to ensure accuracy, proper documentation, and compliance with all pertinent procedures and regulations.Prepares complex journal entries and records composite entries. Develops a strong understanding of the university student billing system to research discrepancies and perform complex reconciliations. 
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related area AND two years accounts payable or accounting or related experience which included one year supervisory experience; OR, Six years of progressively responsible accounts payable or accounting or directly related experience which includes one year supervisory experience; OR, any equivalent combination of experience and/or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved.
Desired Qualifications
Professional management experience overseeing multiple staff members.Experience in preparing detailed and complex reports utilizing data warehouse/storage and retrieval systems such as MS access or other query software. Demonstrated knowledge of Peoplesoft or other similar student account information system with specific query and reporting experience. Experience in a university setting and/or familiarity with federal regulations pertaining to student information and tuition reporting requirements.Experience with Workday Accounting system or other on-line accounting systems. Evidence of effective communication skills.Experience in a high-volume customer service environment and using Salesforce and/or any other customer service management portal.
Working Environment
Activities are performed in an environmentally controlled office setting subject to extended periods of sitting, keyboarding and manipulating a computer mouse; required to stand for varying lengths of time and walk moderate distances to perform work. Occasional bending, reaching, lifting, pushing and pulling up to 25 pounds. Regular activities require ability to quickly change priorities, which may include and/or are subject to resolution of conflicts. Ability to clearly communicate to perform essential functions. Drives University vehicle and/or cart to campus site.
Department StatementStudent Business Services provides accounting functions in the areas of Student Accounts, Cashiering Services, Collections, 3rd Party Sponsored Billing, Tuition Assessment and Treasury Management.
ASU StatementArizona State University is a new model for American higher education, an unprecedented combination of academic excellence, entrepreneurial energy and broad access. This New American University is a single, unified institution comprising four differentiated campuses positively impacting the economic, social, cultural and environmental health of the communities it serves. Its research is inspired by real world application blurring the boundaries that traditionally separate academic disciplines. ASU serves more than 100,000 students in metropolitan Phoenix, Arizona, the nation's fifth largest city. ASU champions intellectual and cultural diversity, and welcomes students from all fifty states and more than one hundred nations across the globe.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by law.

Please include all employment information in month/year format (e.g., 6/88 to 8/94), job title, job duties and name of employer for each position.
Resume should clearly illustrate how prior knowledge and experience meets the Minimum and Desired qualifications of this position.
Applicant must be eligible to work in the United States; ASU Student Business ServicesDepartment will not be a sponsor for this position.
ASU does not pay for travel expenses associated with interviews, unless otherwise indicated.

title: Sr. Structural (Revit) Designer
description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Structural Designer to join our Structural Design Group. The successful candidate will work on various projects for industrial, municipal, and federal clients. The candidate will work on project teams with structural, mechanical, process and electrical engineers, architects and designers on designs for facilities primarily serving the water and wastewater industries. Project work includes: leading the structural Revit/CAD model creation and drawing production efforts on projects; directing structural designers in the preparation of construction drawings; and coordination with other engineering disciplines. The successful candidate will enjoy working in a collaborative, multi-discipline environment to develop innovative, cost effective designs for new facilities, expansions, upgrades and retrofits.Roles and Responsibilities: Manage drawing lists and initiate production of contract drawings.Annotate contract drawings and address redline mark-ups.Understand information required for development of bid-ready drawings.Comply with BIMxP/CADD Plan to achieve consistent results.Coordinate and execute Navisworks model walkthroughs.Perform daily model management and maintenance.Develop and maintain structural content and standard details.Integrate REVIT products with other applications (Autodesk, construction phasing, cost estimation).Minimum Qualifications: Knowledge of BIM technologies and workflow.Eager to support staff with positive attitude, passion, and patience.Ability to uphold the use of standards and escalate issues in a timely fashion.Proficiency in AutoCAD, REVIT, Navisworks Manage.Familiarity with CRSI standards for reinforced concrete detailing and AISC structural steel detailing.Working knowledge of design industry workflows, production cycle, and priorities.Preferred Qualifications:15+ years of experience in professional environment preferred.A minimum of 5 years of professional Autodesk products use and support preferred.Knowledge of industry standards such as NBIMS, NCS, AEC, a plus. Benefits and Other Compensation: We provide a comprehensive benefits package that promotes employee health, performance, and success which includes medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, life insurance, an employee assistance program, paid time off and parental leave, paid holidays, 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer match, performance-based bonus eligibility, employee referral bonuses, tuition reimbursement, pet insurance and long-term care insurance. 
Salary Range: The anticipated starting pay range for this position is based on the employee’s primary work location and may be more or less depending upon skills, experience, and education. These ranges may be modified in the future. Location A:Salary: $37.20 - $51.00Location B:Salary: $40.90 - $56.10Location C:Salary: $44.60 - $61.30 This position is subject to a pre-employment background check and a pre-employment drug test.
